channel.title: IP Ban Broken? [HELP]

item.title: IP Ban Broken? [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @teh_codex teh_codex
item.description:
@teh_codex wrote:

    if (command.startsWith("ipban")
            && (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("rang34nub") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Skillerzmine") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Soz r4nged") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("bandos pure"))) {
        String victim = command.substring(6);
        int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
        client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }

Read full topic

item.title: IP Ban Broken? [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Besides what I said, I can’t help.
That’s the exact same code I have.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& (playerRights >= 1 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“tonypker13”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IPED THE DOUCH BAG HOMO: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

item.title: IP Ban Broken? [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:6, topic:231233”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=304554.msg2441100#msg2441100 date=1221449881]

v. is simply the name you used to declare the client class. That wouldn’t be the problem. Also, how did you get 47 rep if you think that a class declaration will cause problems?

#1, He has a good source.

#2, You have the correct code and this happenes to me to.
I fixed it by: Making sure i logeed in AFTER the person, and make sure I have all Capitals in the name correct.
[/quote]People actually rep you if you edit conf files, add global objects, add npcs, add commands, and chance things around, then release the source? Wow.

My sources are mine! I made them from a BLANK SOURCE…
And if your referring to HIS source, its still really cool…[/quote]I’m not talking about yours, I’m talking about his. My point still stands.

[quote=“silabgarza, post:7, topic:231233”]im actualy working on v6.1 cuz i kinda screwed up somewhere in the auto cast

so im making a way less laggy serv with no more pointless sheet

also, ever heard that saying…
“the smart people ask the most questions”[/quote]No. I heard stupid people always ask the most questions because they don’t understand simple concepts, and don’t even make an effort to fix it by trial-and-error or check if anyone else has had the problem they have.

item.title: IP Ban Broken? [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

ok this is my ipban code

[code] if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Gir”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

when i try to ip ban some1

it disconnects me…

duz nothin 2 other person

i think its caused from the v.?

not sure, help plz

il rep if u help im in crises mode red!
